direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods involve generating random data, with hex() using the output of nextRandomBytes() to create a hexadecimal string.
Both methods generate random values within a specified range, though hex() generates a string and nextLong() generates a long integer.
Both methods generate random values within a specified range, though hex() generates a string and nextDouble() generates a double.
Both methods encode data into a string format, though hex() encodes into hexadecimal and encodeBase64() encodes into Base64.
Both methods generate unique identifiers, though hex() generates a random hexadecimal string and generateUUID() generates a UUID.
